metadata.title: CVE-2022-45406 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
If an out-of-memory condition occurred when creating a JavaScript global, aJavaScript realm may be deleted while references to it lived on in aBaseShape. This could lead to a use-after-free causing a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.5,Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox < 107.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
